summary: Key findings on Nepal 2026 election dynamics: NC and UML competing in all 165 FPTP seats (no alliance for HoR), RSP strengthened by Balen/Ghising mergers, NCP formed from Maoist Centre + leftist merger, Gen Z anti-incumbency against establishment parties
content:
## Election Date: March 5, 2026
275 seats: 165 FPTP + 110 PR

## 2022 Results:
- NC: 89 seats (57 FPTP + 32 PR), 25.71% PR vote
- CPN-UML: 78 seats (44 FPTP + 34 PR), 26.95% PR vote
- Maoist Centre: 32 seats (18 FPTP + 14 PR), 11.13% PR vote
- RSP: 20 seats (7 FPTP + 13 PR), 10.70% PR vote
- RPP: 14 seats (7 FPTP + 7 PR), 5.58% PR vote

## Key 2026 Dynamics:
1. NC-UML alliance ONLY for upper house (National Assembly), NOT for House of Representatives
2. Both NC and UML field candidates in ALL 165 FPTP constituencies - competing against each other
3. RSP merged with Balen Shah and Kulman Ghising's Ujyaalo Nepal Party (so UNP no longer exists separately)
4. NCP formed from merger of 9 leftist factions including Maoist Centre
5. Gen Z protests (Sep 2025) forced Oli's resignation and dissolution of parliament
6. NC new leader: Gagan Thapa (younger), Deuba opted out
7. RSP claims confident of being largest but analysts warn limited rural reach
8. RSP fielding 162 FPTP candidates (147 direct + 15 indirect), NCP 163 (152+11), RPP 163 (154+9)
